review: Over priced for what we got....Plain pizza was very bland, mostly crust and over cooked, the cheese and sauce on top nearly dried up. Chinese chicken salad was good. But I liked the cheesecake factorie's version better. Will not be returning.

I'm sorry for the blatant thievery.  We are good parents, I swear.  We try to teach them the right things like try pooping in the potty, don't eat the toothpaste, and don't go running around without diapers.  But, toddlers will be toddlers.  So, in a very public apology, I'm sorry that our toddler took the crayons.  It was rather ambiguous whether they were meant to be returned, taken home, or thrown around in the restaurant.  Just be glad the toddler didn't practice her ABCs on your walls.  Or maybe she did---who knows, I was nose deep in the Sam Adams.   Remember the first time we ever met?  It was 15 years ago.  You were naive and fresh.  I was still single.  You had these spunky innovative creations like adding pear and gorgonzola on a pizza.  Fifteen years past, and a mortgage and a kid later, you still wow me.  Not with your innovative creations, but the free crayons and the ability to keep diaper wearing customers occupied.  How you've evolved from the innovative California free spirit to a place that serves crayons with your food.   Tonight, you provided us a pizza with Japanese egglpant, peppers, and red onions.  As expected---good like always.   And our toddler---a buttery noodle dish that would cause individuals like me to go through a quadruple stent bypass.  And the $1 dessert....now, that truly is wowing.  The financial person in me wonders if you even make money on selling it for a $1.  Of course, it was all whipped cream and pieces of M&Ms, with barely a spoon of ice cream...but, that was probably a good thing, since the sugar-crayon combination can make the toddler go haywire.   We'll be back, like always----toddler in tow.

I truly enjoyed my half-portion ($11.25) Miso Shrimp Salad.  It was fresh, crunchy and 4-star delicious (dressing on the side).  My husband, however did not enjoy his $13.50 Sicillian thin-crust (isn't THAT an oxymoron) pizza.  He said frozen Freschetta was better. Shame. Decent service.  High prices.  Mediocre food. Crawling with kids and families. I would go back - but not in a hurry. A nice alternative to the food court.

Worst CPK I have ever been to. Almost half of the restaurant had empty tables but they could not sit us right away because they were understaffed with only 3 waiters serving the entire place! While we were waiting, they lost the business of a total of 8 other customers who refused to wait. Their business could have afforded you to schedule another waiter! The maitre'd was a rude man who stood around just waiting for other customers to disappoint. Why not be proactive and help the other staff instead of doing nothing? By the time we got seated, the table was not fully clean. Our waitress, although very nice, was serving a third of all customers so the service was very slow. Food was OK but the poor overall experience will ensure we will not return here again.

I will never return again to this place after our visit yesterday. We have gone a few times and it was never spectacular so I'm not sure why we ever went back but his parents wanted to go again and that will be our last visit. For once, the waitress wasn't that great, yes she was nice, but our appetizers came out before our drinks even came. How is that possible? Because it means you're slacking. No it wasn't even busy there so I can't even give her that excuse. The hummus appetizer was pretty good, decent I would say. His parents enjoyed their salads and dessert was decent, same as any chain dessert. Now why the 1 star? I ordered garlic cream fettuccine with mushrooms and broccoli, which by the way isn't broccoli florets, more like broccolini and he ordered the vegetarian pizza with no cheese. Because we're vegetarian. Sounds easy.. it didn't taste terrible, pretty good.. and what do I find? CHICKEN! SERIOUSLY CHICKEN!?!?!?!? I didn't order chicken! And he found BACON! Yes, BACON on a VEG-E-TAR-IAN pizza. BIG problem. I was mortified by this and when the waitress came we told her and she apologized saying that she was going to get her manager. Well when you have a problem like that you get your manager RIGHT AWAY, not serve other tables and get drinks and then find her. NO. The manager apologized and asked if we wanted new meals, why would we? You just made me sick to my stomach. She gave us free desserts, took our meals off, and gave us coupons to come back.. which is VERY doubtful. After this last visit, we won't be returning and I don't think it's worth it for anyone else to go there either unless you're absolutely desperate.

Nice ambiance in this alternative to the food court at the mall. Young, but willing servers, do a competent job of describing the menu. The bar adds a nice touch to the mall dining experience. The problem is the food. The Tortilla soup was without flavor. The angel hair w/ tomato basil was dry and tasteless as well. Most egregious of all, the pizza was lousy. Despite having a brick oven on premise, the crust was soggy and limp. The sauce was an even greater offender and couldnt even pass muster with our 8 year old. They even served tasteless Arnie Palmers. I could have lived with the cloying appeals to fill out comment cards, if the food had been better than blah. Maybe for a happy hour? Maybe for a break-up date.

Been here multiple times. Food is great BUT the service is just terrible. Staff just doesn't care. Each time I have been there I have walked out saying I won't be back but a few months later I'm there for the food and realize once again how bad the service is. Management should really do something about this. Go only if willing to deal with sub par service.

Summary: Terrible seating policy; Manager/hostess humiliate customers  We were here in a group of 5 (incl. 3 children) on Saturday night for dinner. After a long wait we were seated, 45 minutes later. Given the long wait and hungry children we decided to try a table of 4. Realizing it was too cramped, we requested the next available suitable sized table only minutes after being seated. We were at first informed that couldn't be done since we were already seated! Reluctantly the hostess agreed after persuasion. After a while when nobody came around to get us while seeing larger tables opening up, we checked in at the front. We were told to seat ourselves at a table that the hostess pointed to from afar. We thought this was rude and discourteous though decided to not make a big deal.  As we walked over to the other table (kids and water cups in tow), we were confronted by the Manager in the middle of the restaurant. It was awkward to be standing holding water cups in the midst of narrow tables, and being humiliated by the Manager. Quoting the Manager - "I train my staff well enough and doubt that they would tell you can change to another table. From what I understand you agreed to sit at a table of 4. Keep in mind once you are seated we do not allow customers to change tables!"  We informed him that we were changing tables based on their hostess' guidance and that he should perhaps clarify with her first. We felt an apology (after seeking necessary clarifications) was in order. But, no apologies or amends were forthcoming! The Manager was argumentative and defensive. He failed to address our problem in a satisfactory manner. We stayed because it would be unfair to our hungry children to leave without any dinner but we (regular customers at this restaurant) felt so humiliated and will not bring our business here again.

Be ready with your order as soon as you sit down. If you ask for 5 minutes they'll take 20 before they come back. I'm always wary of "bad service" reviews on yelp. So it was with unfortunate deja-vu that we experienced the same thing as many other reviewers here.  The food was fine. Nothing unique. The service was just plain crappy. Seated at a distance (yes I know I have kids, but come on it's not La Bernadin), long delays before the waitress will see you, get your drinks, get back to you, get your cheque etc.). Honestly it got to the point where we were just frustrated. We came in for a quick lunch before getting kids home for a nap - it wasn't that busy - and left swearing not to bother again.

It took a while to get our waiter, but we flagged down another one who apologized and took our drink order right away.  The service seemed friendly and attentive once we got our waiter.   For the food, my wife and I ordered the pizza with the works and a salad.  The salad seemed to be over priced at $9.75 and was sub par with scarce pieces of turkey.  I would not recommend.  The pizza wasn't bad, but the crust on the bottom was under cooked and very doughy, especially towards the center.  Also not sure why thin crust would cost $1.50 more than regular.  Aren't you getting less and paying more? The food was eh and the red apple sangria was the highlight of the meal.

The food is only so-so at this CPK, but the environment is nice and the level of customer service is high.   I forgot to mention my food allergies before I started ordering and only  mentioned it after our server put one of our orders down.  The manager was extremely accommodating and understanding even though my allergens weren't in the dish itself.  He said he didn't want to take a risk because there may have been cross-contamination and wanted me to be able to enjoy my food so they remade the salad at no extra cost, even though it was my fault for not citing my allergies from when I ordered.   Ordered their BBQ Hawaiian Chicken Pizza and the Moroccan Spiced Chicken salad.  The pizza was only so-so.  I felt like the cheese wasn't piping hot and the blend of flavors wasn't to my liking.  The chicken salad was pretty good though - the full size is HUGE so if you don't have a big appetite, I'd recommend going with their half size one.  The figs in this salad are especially good.

While I've seen CPK's elsewhere, today was the first time I actually sat down in one to eat.  Located in a corner of the lower portion of the Bridgewater Commons mall, this restaurant is out of the way and right across from restrooms.  This is actually a good thing as you don't have tons of mall traffic stomping by you as you eat, though a chunk of the restaurant blocks out the mall visually via a wall. Decorated in dark colors with attractive wood decorative pieces on the ceiling, CPK has some nice big booths to sit in as well as tables.  CPK adopts the "open kitchen/kitchen as theater" philosophy where you can watch the food being prepared including the pizza oven complete with dramatic flame lit up.  If you really want to get close to the kitchen you can sit at the bar which faces the kitchen directly. My girlfriend and I were seated quickly and our waitress was at our table in a snap.  She was very pleasant and prompt with our drinks and taking our orders.  We wound up ordering an arugula salad with pine nuts, sun dried tomatoes and cheese, a "half" cobb salad (tomato, greens, blue cheese, bacon etc.), the "wild mushroom" pizza and their "Korean" pizza (with pork and kimchi slaw on top).  Both pizzas were ordered using the "honey wheat whole wheat" dough. The salads were both delicious though the arugula was less peppery than expected.  The cobb was super tasty and the bacon they used in it was super tasty and smokey. The pizzas were, much to my surprise, super tasty!  The mushroom pizza had a wonderful, Earthy flavor to it thanks to the cheese and mushroom combination.  The Korean pizza was flavorful with a nice tang thanks to the slaw on top.  The honey wheat whole wheat dough was tasty, chewy and warm with no sogginess from the sauce and cheese.   I really enjoyed my time at California Pizza Kitchen.  One minor note, one of our silverware settings was dirty so we had to have it replaced, but that's hardly a deal breaker.  I was very happy with my first "CPK" experience!

I used to enjoy CPK about 8-10 years ago.  More recently I had stopped enjoying their pizzas... too much bread to topping ratio.  I used to opt for their pastas and salads.  However, today I was back here and tried their new Hand Tossed pizza... the crust was fresh, soft inside and crisp outside... the pizza crust to topping ration was just right and I actually enjoyed it enough to finish the entire pizza. I had their Wild Mushroom pizza.  The last time I had this pizza, not only it had the dough/base/crust issue, the mushrooms too seemed like they were not properly cooked and were too garlicky.  This time around it had none of those problems... the only thing was that it seemed to not have enough mushrooms... a tad bit more would make it perfect.

Been here several times on the way home from my shop in PA.  Service is very efficient and the food is always extremely tasty and delicious.  I like the consistently good service and food.  Tonight I had a very minor issue which the host and manager took very seriously.  It really wasn't necessary for them to jump through hoops, so this was a good demonstration of the concern this establishment has for maintaining customer satisfaction.  Highly recommend.

Don't waste your time. Horrible service and truly non-enjoyable dining experience. You have been warned. Our waitress spent 15 minutes listening to a table tell a story about wine ... Really, do you not think you have other tables or is this your first waitress job?

I am a fan of CPK in general. The food is pretty good and their new small plates menu is interesting and tasty. They have an Habanero Carnitas pizza (you must like spicy and you must eat pork) that is just amazing. That habanero sauce that comes with it is fiery, but delicious. My advice--start slow! The only gripe I have is this location feels a little dingy to me. I've been to other CPK locations that are beautiful and bright and feel like a more upscale dining experience. This location feels in the Applebee's/TGIFridays range to me.
Consistently disappointing! The biggest issue is slow service. Food is sometimes ok, but never great and it ALWAYS takes forever.  Lots of staff on but no one seems to be managing.

Came here for an afternoon lunch and cocktail.  Very crowded on a Friday, early afternoon.  Nice atmosphere.  Ordered the white corn guacamole small plate, guacamole and chips, spicy fennel sausage and poblano flatbread, and a cosmo marguarity.  All excellent.  Fast, friendly service.  No complaints.  Would come here again.

I like their food but waited 40 minutes to get half the plates of our table and they were all cold. Waitress (Agata) didn't even acknowledged the fact that it took too long and then half the food was wrong. No apologies. No nothing. Lady and her daughter sitting next to us waited 15 minutes and nobody took their order.

Had lunch at California Pizza Kitchen yesterday. The service was good, but the food was very so-so. I could not even eat the quinoa salad that I ordered because of how salty it was. The restaurant manager apologized for the overly salty salad and even offered to bring me a different salad from the menu. The caramelized peaches spinach salad that my granddaughter ordered was very good, though. Our waitress, Vanessa, was pleasant and efficient. The restaurant needs more wait staff, though, as Vanessa was also working on a computer/register in addition to serving customers. I would go back to this restaurant as I would like to give it another try.

Love the food- hate the service - that about sums up our experience today at CPK.  Problem appeared to be in the kitchen rather than with our waiter today, though he did ask if I wanted him to refill my water.  WTF?  If the water is low and you just served the meal then refill it.   The problem today apparently was that the kitchen made the wrong pizza for me.  So I had to wait while they made me a new one.  To their credit they did not change me for the pizza and even gave me a free entree next time.  This is why I am giving it 3 stars instead of 1 star.

5 stars all around  I have never been to any cpk restaurants besides buying their frozen pizza in the supermarket if that even counts, but very good expirience on the very first visit which does not happen too often. The service was great waiter was very prompt and friendly. I wasn't too sure on what to get I was thinking the pizza was goin to be big since every other pizza restaurant that I have gone too have served them large for 2 ppl to share.I was told that theirs were personal size but a little bigger than say for example pizza hut's. I ordered the pepperoni,mushroom and sausage   was amazing and very good.I gotta say enjoyed the expirience there.and will go back in the future.

Here's the deal... CPK is a well known chain and despite some of the reviews about service, I've never had a poblem here.  Obviously the varieties of pizzas can suit almost all customers.   Certainly a good spot to stop in when you're in the Bridgewater Mall area.

Always a good time here. I still don't think they take reservations so be careful with your time and hunger needs. Love the Mediterranean chicken salad and pear and Gorgonzola pizza. Waiter was lovely and super helpful.

Not really sure how this place has such low reviews.  We go here often when we visit the mall and have always had a good experience.  The one time they made a mistake with our order, they fixed it.  I guess it's luck of the draw, but after 15+ visits, and no horrible experiences, I just think it's a pretty solid bet for a place to eat.   The pizzas are great for what they are (don't compare them to NYC pizza) and they have lots of variety.  We love their salads too, especially the Thai and Carmelized Peach salads.

Terrible service. No service at all. After they seated us, no one came over for a long time, not even to say that they'll take our drink orders. I saw waiters and waitresses just joking and fooling around so they weren't busy at all. We just got up and left. Oh well they don't care about their customers at all.

This update is just for a quick note about customer service - I had stopped by earlier this weekend for a pair of pizzas while visiting the family for the holiday break, one of which was our family's favorite, the Tostada Pizza. Its got a great combination of fresh veggies that serves as a semi-hybrid between a pizza and a taco, and in all, is definitely 'good eats.' Picking up at this CPK is super easy, thanks to the reserved parking spots right in front of the entrance (it's at a mall), and I got my pizzas and was home in no time. Unfortunately, after coming home, we noticed that the Tostada Pizza was devoid of all the great toppings, so it was just a bean spread and cheese pizza, and with the weather outside being nasty, were in no mood to trek all the way back. I called in and they had me speak to a manager, who apologized and offered right away to refund the pizza to our gift card. While that didn't quite work out due to a technical issue on CPK's end, a different manager, Megan, really demonstrated exceptional customer service and offered to mail out an equivalent gift card to us right away, all the while apologizing and explaining how she was just looking to ensure that we were happy. In all, she took an iffy situation and really gave a great example of how to handle customer issues. Kudos!

Favorite stop at the mall . Usually if it's busy I'll try to sit at the bar with a few of my friends and the bar tenders are always pleasant !! The big beer bottles they serve are inexpensive and go great with the pizza ! Last night we went after dinner for some drinks, the bar tender was kind enough to give us some chips and salsa even though we weren't ordering . It does get very crowded plan accordingly ! Always fun watching the open kitchen area while they're making the pizzas . Great atmosphere and food haven't had any problems with service .
Great Bar Service and tasty drinksFood always tasty and hot!!! Love the service!!! I visit this restaurant at least monthly!!!!! I highly recommend trying it!!!!!

Amazing food, Kung pao pasta was just mind blowing. Tostada pizza was just average though. California veggie special was good. We had a birthday boy with us and the staff was real friendly and amazing to serve us with a small truffle cake which was like cherry on the cake. All in all a good lunch and fun time.

I don't normally write reviews for chain restaurants but this was my first time ever eating at a California Pizza Kitchen and I figured I would add my 2 cents. The food was okay, service was friendly and the price was rather expensive. My fiance and I ordered the barbecue chicken pizza with bacon because that's what they're famous for and frankly I didn't know what else to order. The pizza was decent but very small and kind of expensive. If you're really hungry, I would almost suggest ordering 2 pizzas for 2 people but you're probably looking at around 13-15 bucks for a pizza slightly larger than a personal. The place is okay for lunch or a casual dinner if your hanging out at the mall but don't go out of your way to eat here. The best thing though is the crispy bacon. They should just serve that stuff on a stick and call it quits.

I was pleasantly surprised!  When I think pizza chain, I assume it to be typical, run of the mill - certainly not comparable to my favorite jersey slice.  However, the wild mushroom pizza I ordered was absolutely delicious and fresh.  I would definitely go again.
I only give it four stars because sometimes the takeout orders take longer than what they tell you, other than that they have great service and great food!

I was feeling homesick for California, and even though I know that this place is not Californian in any meaningful way, we went.  Server asked if we'd been before, and when I said no, she suggested that their pizzas were "personal" size, and that we should definitely order 1 per person. This was overkill; no one could eat more than 2/3 of theirs, and our party included a teenage athlete. We started with the white corn guacamole. It came with disappointing cardboardy chips, but the guac itself was fantastic, about 50/50 avocado/corn with some cilantro, pepper, and jicama thrown in.  I had a half order of the Thai Crunch salad with avocado. It was perfectly serviceable, but not mindblowing. I am not sure how a person could eat a full order -- I could not finish the half and I am not a dainty eater. I like my salads lightly dressed and this one was. I imagine if you prefer a normal/heavily dressed salad, you would probably want to ask for extra. All of the pizzas at our table were the regular "hand tossed" ones. Nice thin crust, and the ingredients were high quality. Not too cheesy, and not at all like the typical Jersey slice -- more like the brick-oven style.

Listen, we generally like this place but dammit if half the time they don't send a server to our table until I complain after sitting there for 10-15 min. Then we get the server who has walked past our table 5 times, ignored us and arced people who walked in after us. Better training of staff is needed I think. Food is still pretty good.

I love this place!  It's easy to get to, in the Bridgewater Mall, if there's a wait, it seems to move fast. The servers (all young people) are friendly and attentive. I have never eaten one bad meal there and my husband and I go there about once a month. Going here cheers me up...it's bright and you can people watch as you face the mall.  My fav is the Thai salad. For half a salad, it's huge!  Love the beer!  My husband usually gets their pasta and loves it.  We've had the pizza too and I was very impressed !  Love the mushroom/spinach flatbread. Can't say enough about my love for CPK!

Although I had some issue with the dessert, the overall feel of the place and the quality of the food was phenomenal. They started with complementary bread and olive oil, and from there I ordered a fried cheese ball oddity for an appetizer, and while a bit on the greasy side, it was a very good start to my dish. And their Sicilian pizza was just the right amount of spice, cheese, and bread. Though, I warn you, their thin crust pizzas, literally are THIN crust. After a large pizza, one would think that it'd be nice to get a dessert to top everything off... But their desserts were lacking (just not in quantity). $6.50 desserts, ice cream an extra $1.50... Sickeningly sweet, scoops of whipped cream larger than the (very large) dessert itself... Overall, very gaudy and inexpertly done. Service could be a bit better, they only gave out one napkin per person, albeit a large napkin. But I may just be picky since I was sat at a table next to a couple with a screaming child...

The place itself is nice and the server was fine.  This is a chain that clearly has a emphasis on portion control to the point that it's so skimpy.  We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and there was either one or two slivers of chicken on each slice.  Also ordered the BBQ Chicken salad and added the quacamole for $2.75.  I got 7 tiny cubes of quac that probably equated to a 1/6 of a quacamole.  I purchase my own at home all the time so I have a pretty accurate feel for how much was given.  I read another viewer say that received complimentary bread, and I saw another table with a basket of bread on their table...we did not get any on our visit yesterday.  Very unsatisfying visit.  I wish I felt like I ate chicken on my BBQ Chicken Pizza and I wish I felt like I got quacamole even when paying extra for it...so unsubstantial amount that it was like non existent.

The food is average and a bit over priced for what you get, but this is a restaurant in a shopping mall so they have their over head to pay.  What made my experience so awesome was the service from Tyler.  He was one great server!  He was honest, thorough, and made our dining experience a lot of fun.  I hope people appreciate what a great worker he is and tip him well above the norm.  He deserves every dollar he makes.
Good fresh food. Excellent service (Stefan).  My wife's choice of Thai Pizza was better than my California Club which was in fact excellent too!  Will be back soon. Excellent post-movie spot.

Have a great experience at this CPK. -- good quality food and drink (we had "the works" pizza + "appleburry sangria" and loved them) -- very nice staff -- cool atmosphere  -- convenient location at the Bridgewater mall Why not 5? 1. We were given paper napkins, cloth napkins would be nicer. 2. At the time, I am not sure if the service and food are consistently good. We plan to definitely go back again and if we get the same great quality, I will consider changing it to 5.

Very good lunch, went with the roasted garlic chicken pizza. Crispy crust, yet soft and warm inside. Little heavy on the onion, but was tasty. The chicken could have been better, but over they pie was juicy.  We had three Stella's and came out to around $40 with tip.

This is the 3rd and last time at this location. Food is always just ok, and service is always subpar. This last time did me in because I was waiting with my kids to be seated. The restaurant was practically empty, yet with the 15 workers, all of them must have had blinders on because I stood there for 5 minutes before someone came to seat us. The same service was repeated the rest of the meal. I had to wave down my server, then when he brought the wrong meal, I had to get up and find him, and I also had to get up to get my check. This was mainly because the workers were busy socializing with each other instead of waiting on customers. To make matters worse, when I went to sign my credit card, they charged me over $20 more by accident. It's a good thing I checked the bill before just signing it. The food was also just bland and not worth the frustration. Will not be going back again.

My daughter and I went there for lunch and neither of us were very impressed . I understand it's a mall and it is the Saturday before Christmas, but giving us plates with tomato sauce still on them is not right. The server was nice enough, but bringing out my soup with the pizza was another snafu. Again it was busy, but the soup was cold and was sent back. I will try the place again, but I'm not expecting much

I came here for lunch today and got the lettuce wraps with chicken. I found something hard in them, pointed it out to my waiter and he alerted the manager right away. Not only did she pay for my meal, but she personally inspected the area where the food was being prepared, and paid for a new dish for me to bring home. The service is excellent, and I am totally comfortable eating their food again since I know they put so much effort into ensuring its quality.

First time here and will never go back. Food was so disappointing. 45 mins to get seated and almost 2 hours for our food. When it came out, the pizza and pasta was cold. I rather go Chuck E Cheese for pizza, taste way better than this place.
Food was okey. We ordered Kung Pao sphagetti which was okey. We had to wait almost half hour to get appetizers even. They can improve the service by training the waiters.

**Gluten-free options** I was recently here with my husband for a weekday lunch since we were already at the mall.  The restaurant was fairly busy at this hour, but we were seated immediately.  The waitress was attentive and service was OK - a bit slow. I ordered the gluten-free pizza with mushroom, pepperoni, and sausage.  The sausage was listed as spicy, but, boy, was my mouth on fire!!!  I can tolerate a good amount of heat, but this spicy sausage was so unpleasant I couldn't eat the whole thing.   My husband, a lover of Thai food, had the Thai Chicken pizza and thought it was very good. CPK is a better choice than your food court options.  As an overall restaurant, it's not somewhere I would chose to eat if I were going out with friends or on a date night.

I recently went here for the first time with my friends last week. It was great. Everyone liked their food. Mine was delicious, I got one of their sandwiches. Usually sandwiches that have avocado, get little avocado but they actually put a good amount of avocado! For dessert I ordered their red velvet cake and was later informed by the manager they were all out. She quickly offered to buy me another dessert which was extremely nice of her! Will be returning!
We have been coming here for two years now and the food and service have consistently been great. Fun atmosphere. Great crew. They must love their job.

Haven't been here in a long time after sever disappointment with food quality, service and staff. Looks like the place is being managed well! Staff are very fast and attentive. my roommate eats there at lease 2-3 times a week. The fish tacos are really good i actually enjoyed it. sesame ginger dumplings are also quite tasty, i usually get the blackberry fizz and have some rum thrown in there too YUMMY!!! I don't frequent here often because of service inconsistencies but the ribeye was excellent and juicy. I think I'd come back just for that if need be.

Dined here on Valentines day, and waited 30 minutes for dinner service.  We were told a table would be ready in 45, so we were pretty happy about that!  The food was pretty good, we ordered the Jamaican Jerk Pizza which was excellent, and a spaghetti dish that was ok.  The staff were all extremely friendly, and we will be back!

I'll break this review down as my dinner progresses  SEATING- quite a few areas to choose from. I chose a table with a view of the mall. I came on a Monday, the place was pretty empty. I was seated immediately.  DRINKS-I had a patron margarita and a new sangria that's not quite on the menus yet. Both drinks were great and were made well. Pizza: excellent- I enjoy the club house on a thin crust.  All in all great service and a GREAT TIME....

I visited California pizza in bridgewater on Wednesday night. I was in the mood for pizza and I heard they had a great dessert. We started with the spring rolls. We ordered the vegetable ones and the chipotle ones.  They were delicious and served with guacamole...which was a huge bonus! I ordered the five cheese pizza with tomatoes. I personally like my pizza soft and it was cooked perfectly. My mother in law ordered the margarita pizza...thin crust. Unfortunately the bottom was burnt and she ended up scraping most of the black off. I was the only one to order dessert...shocker...highly recommend the butter cake.  Served warm with vanilla ice cream...so moist!!! Service was great!

Visited CPK for the very first time.  We ordered the Hawaiian, California Club, and Garlic roasted Chicken pizza.  All came out very good.  The owner is constantly going around how guests are doing.  Will definitely try the place again in the future.

Went in for dinner. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken thin crust pizza and it was absolutely delicious. It was a lot for two people so plan accordingly. We also tried the Sangria Flight and it was delightful. The drinks tasted fruity and sweet and I could hardly taste the alcohol, although I'd advise taking your time drinking it because they are strong. The only I have to say is that the fried mac and cheese appetizer was quite a disappointment. I'm personally not a fan of Fried Mac and cheese, but even I've had better Mac and cheese than what was given to us.  Overall, it was a great experience. I personally feel that the fried Mac and cheese throws the menu off a bit and if it's a dish that stands out, it should wow the customers.

After being seated immediately, I had to wait two minutes for a waiter to ask me what I wanted to drink. (Strike 1 for waiting.) While my boyfriend went to the restroom, I ordered the drinks and meals for both of us.  I neglected to remember that my boyfriend wanted chicken with his spaghettini. When I let him know later, the waiter apologized profusely when I requested chicken and immediately put the order in. Good grief. (Strike 2 for not reading my mind about the chicken.)  Then, the food (without the chicken) came out so fast! The waiter apologized that the chicken didn't come out with the rest of the food, which was my fault all along. (Strike 3 for chicken not coming out on time.)  Can't believe we were seated immediately, apologized to for my own mistake, received stellar service throughout our meal, and had a delicious meal to top it all off. How dare that restaurant!  Just kidding. Thank you so much STEFAN for an excellent experience! We will be back!!

Well my boyfriend and I made the mistake of ordering sandwiches instead of pizza at a pizza place... We both got the grilled chicken sandwich, and the bread was horribly tough, similar to a brick, and hurts your gums when you are trying to bite into it. I got soup, the baked potato and it was great. I also got a sangria flight, which was awesome! Just order the pizza, don't get a sandwich.

Past couple times I've been here it's been ok, staff could be friendlier. I mean at least pleasant to be around. I personally love the chipotle chicken pizza but no poblanos too spicy for my liking, the rarely remember my request for no poblanos unless I bring up the previous time where they forgot. Is suggest the white corn guacamole and the club egg rolls as a starter they're always awesome. I wouldn't say the staff and minor issues are enough to keep me from going there, but! It's definitely something they should enforce. At least smile and not act like its torture serving me.

Just ok. The food tastes good but the service wasn't the best. A lot of employees standing around chit-chatting and our server didn't seem in the best mood after a while.  I ordered the original salad, half portion, but it was huge which was great! But I also ordered the Chips and Guacamole appetizer and they really skimped on the guacamole! Definitely not enough for the amount of chips they give.
Excellent food and service. Location in a nice, upscale mall. Our server was very friendly and helpful as well.

1) Waited waited and waited for 40+ min to see the first piece of food on our table...after reminding twice. No 'sorry' from the server. 2) When we did finally get our food, out of 4 of us, two got wrong food. No 'sorry' from the server in any shape or form. 2) Our server never served us the initial bread and oil. When i tried to remind her about it, she responded with 'it is not yet ready' even before i complete my sentence. Of course, no 'sorry' from her yet again. 3) Few other issues like, no forks/spoons, missing sauces with the pizza..etc. etc. 4) But one thing that compelled me to write here is that after so many screw ups on a single table of 4, not a single 'sorry'. Not once. Not in any form. In fact, the look on our server's face was more like...'oh well! Deal with it'. I am always the kind of guy that give people the benefit of doubt and always look for reasons to appreciate things but it was just a horrible service the whole time. The place wasn't super busy so not sure what was going on. One or two mistakes happen, but they just kept screwing it up + never shown a sign of remorse.  Won't be going to this location for sure.

Second time at a California Pizza. Service was good. Atmosphere was good. But something was missing.  I ordered spinach and mushrooms flatbread accompanied with a 10 oz Mark West.  Wine was good. Flatbread was tasty but it was missing something, maybe fresh roasted garlic or drizzle of olive oil. I would try it again.

Love the Tostada and Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizzas. Both are amazing! Also loved the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti. The hummus and spinach artichoke were pretty good. The California Veggie and Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower was just okay.

Located in the Bridgewater Commons Mall. Not a bad spot to have lunch while shopping inside the mall. Service was decent. The environment is nice to have a sit down meal.  We ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza, Hawaiian Pizza, Pesto Cream Pasta, Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower, and Chips with Guacamole.  Thai Chicken Pizza was decent. A nice crispy taste from the green onions, bean sprouts. Flavor was nice.  The Hawaiian Pizza was good. A good sweet taste. Wish they cut the pineapple into smaller pieces because they were huge.  The Pesto Cream Pasta was alright. Creamy and decent taste.  Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower was quite delicious. Healthy version than having chicken wings. Good spicy flavor.  Chips and guacamole was okay.  Would come back only if I was hungry while shopping inside the mall.

First I have to say that this is one of the dirtiest California Pizza kitchen.   Our visit started with being seated at a dirty table which we had to remind the waitress to clean.   I needed to use the ladies room.  When I opened the door there was garbage all over the sink and the floor.  The Glass doors and windows were filthy with fingerprints all over them.  Yuck!   I should have walked the other way but I was starving.

The California Pizza Kitchen is located on the ground floor of the Bridgewater Commons Mall. It's nearby one of the entrances, and thus close to a parking lot for easy access. This establishment, in addition to pizzas, has a variety of cocktails and a decent wine selection. The bread that came with the meal was soft and warm with a pleasant taste when dipped in the oil seasoning. The plain pizza was decent, featuring fresh cheese and pretty standard tomato sauce. The crust and bread used for the pizza didn't stand out too much and was relatively lacking in flavor.  The BBQ Chicken Pizza, while not much of a pizza, was very good. There was a bit of cheese, though not much, and no tomato sauce. Instead of tomato sauce, a delicious barbeque sauce was used instead and onions and parsley were added in addition to the chicken for flavor. The chicken was tender and not dry in the slightest and the overall product was delicious. Overall, this establishment is a decent option for food if one finds them self famished after a long day of shopping.

I like California Pizza kitchen.  Some of their prices could be a little lower, and I never order drinks due to the price.  Their regular menu includes lunch offerings, but we always come around dinner time. I often find I wish I could select something from their lunch menu, but alas, the time.  I like their sandwiches and their soup, usually I get the pea soup or the potato soup.  They have some interesting personal pie choices that are good as well.

Plus five stars, Been there 2 times in one week! The food was so delicious. Yum! I sat in full view of the kitchen and could see the chef making our food. Really clean kitchen. The manager came to our table to check and see if everything was up to our standards on both visits. He remembered us and was very happy to see we visited the again, I liked that he remembered!  I requested a pizza my way which was not on the menu, Avocado, arugula pizza and boy was it delicious! I highly recommend their avocado rolls "oh my" still dreaming of them! They were so good I Found a mock recipe online and going to try to make them at home! California pizza is my new healthy restaurant favorite! Cant wait to go back!

We came here on a Friday evening, seems to be a very busy place. After tasting this freshly made Sicilian pizza, it was well worth the 30 mins wait. Nice thing about it in the mall so that you can spend your wait time in the mall while waiting for them to text you when your table is ready! They are pretty good at holding it for you. The shrimp vegie wrap is pretty good too!

By far the worst CPK experience. Took over an hour to get our food and the restaurant was not busy. On top of that the food was served cold. When asked to speak to the manage the experience didn't get any better. He wasn't apologetic and didn't offer to make the situation, simply asked if he can re heat our food. If it took an hour for our first meal, one can only imagine how long it'll take for a refire. I will not be coming to location anymore. Next time I'll have a DiGiornos instead.

Very good spot located in a popular mall in Central New Jersey.  The appetizer's were very good.  The staff was friendly and the food can fast.  The manager came and welcomed us as first timer's.  Enough food that I had some to take home.  The dessert menu was excellent and we tried two of them.
I like the service, prices are fair, and food is good! Also, the variety of the menu is great. You have the choice of pasta, salafs or pizza and wont be disappointed.
Love the food and atmosphere but the music is way too LOUD. Turn it down please and thank you!

Food: we got the avocado egg rolls, chicken chipotle pizza and shrimp zucchini scampi. The avocado egg rolls were good but on the saltier side because of the bacon (? Not sure if there bacon but I tasted it). The chicken chipotle pizza was interesting. It basically had Mexican toppings on it like beans and tomato and onion. It came with the chipotle sauce on the side which was good because it was pretty spicy so you could adjust how much you wanted on it the shrimp zucchini scampi was not what I expected. It was linguine pasta with an oil based sauce instead of a creamy sauce. It definitely leaned towards the healthier side.  Price: around $50 for all three items. Sorry I don't have the breakdown  Service: good service. Basically all the things we ordered were recommended by our waitress who was very friendly and helpful.  Overall, I think I'd come back again to get the other pizzas. I don't think I'll order any pasta dish next time. After all, it's called California pizza kitchen so I'll stick with the pizza

So my question is to the manager, why did you and others in your organization reach out to me and apologized and you were to send me a gift card. To date no sign of anything to make amends.  Don't understand lack of customer service,  still.

I went in with low expectations, to be quite honest. I personally was advocating for Chipotle, but my family was adamant.  Our server was so sweet! Honestly one of the nicest servers I've ever had-- might have been the nicest. He gave me the recommendation to get this Mexican tortilla soup-- I've never tasted anything like it! It was so flavorful and unique. Lunch was absolutely great!  The pizzas are all absolutely to die for. My personal favorite was the pear-arugula-some crumbly cheese and the Mexican tortilla one. The Margarita was also great and simple. You really can't go wrong with any of the pizza Make sure to save room for desert! Butter cake, as I'm sure you'll here from your waiter, is a restaurant favorite, and for good reason! The chocolate mousse is something I wouldn't skip out on either.  A multitude of vegetarian options, too, which is always a plus!  Definitely will be returning, and it doesn't hurt that it's in the mall either ;)

Sangria flight was great, actually liked all three. Pizzas are individual size cut into 6 slices. BBQ chicken pizza was amazing.  The quality of the food was good. The atmosphere was okay and you sink down into the booth. I was very low to the table compared to if you sat on a chair.  Price of food was a little on the high side.

Just loved it! The vibe and menu were the best! Shared the "The Works" pizza with hubby. So tasty with a bit of everything on it. He had and loved the Sangria flite; I enjoyed my Chardonnay!  Extensive menu, with something for everyone. You can make your pizza thick or thin crust.  Karina, the Manager, skillfully directed behind the scenes. Yaya, our waitstaff and bartender, was wonderfully attentive.   I have no idea why we waited so long to enjoy a great meal and atmosphere there! We will be back and soon!
I didn't really like the food to be honest:/ i don't know if it's because of their ingredients or because of my hatred towards pizza. 3/5 would come again though :)

The atmosphere is pretty chill and the service was excellent! unfortunately the food was very mediocre  and didn't leave much of a "WOW" impression. It was my first time at a CPK and my overall experience was just "meh". I'll come back and explore the menu more sometime.
Went for a launch. Nice, quick and great people work there. Only minus is they have creepy bathroom.

First, this is full-service CPK inside the mall and not a food court type place. Rather large with central bar seating and several dining tables. Charred shishitto peppers were - hmm actually charred and well-done! Another good veggie app is Buffalo cauliflower. Cauli battered and deep fried. Both the apps were good. The house bread with olive oil was ok but not remarkable or signaturish.  California  veggie with goat cheese pizza was average. While the crust was crisp and charred- the wheat dough did not appear too fresh. Same story with the the spinach and artichokes pizza. Garlic creme fettuccini pasta was a little bit bland.  Overall A+ for the apps but B- for the pizza/pasta.
Avocado club egg rolls are amaze-balls. Crispy, smokey, just how I like. Service is good. Busy at times but not overly crazed.
